meanings.definition: The sweet liquid produced by flowers, used by bees to make honey.
meanings.sent1: The nectar from the flowers attracted the bees.
meanings.sent2: She sipped on the refreshing nectar of the orange juice.
meanings.sent3: The garden fairies sprinkled nectar on the flowers for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like nectar, soothing and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The nectar dripped slowly from the petals, glistening in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A delicious drink, especially a fruit juice.
meanings.sent1: The tropical nectar was a favorite among the children.
meanings.sent2: He poured himself a glass of the cold nectar and enjoyed every sip.
meanings.sent3: The party guests clinked their glasses filled with nectar, toasting to friendship.
meanings.sent4: The nectar was so tasty, it felt like a party in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The nectar was a symphony of flavors, dancing on his taste buds.

meanings.definition: The drink of the gods in Greek and Roman mythology.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient tales, only the gods could drink the divine nectar.
meanings.sent2: The golden cup was filled with the sacred nectar of the gods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous god spilled nectar on himself, causing a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the nectar of the gods, bringing joy to all who heard.
meanings.sent5: The nectar of the gods granted immortality to those who dared to taste it.
